013package org.apache.juneau.microservice.jetty;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.IOUtils.read;
019import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
021
022import java.io.*;
023import java.net.*;
024import java.util.*;
025import java.util.logging.*;
026
027import javax.servlet.*;
028
029import org.apache.juneau.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.config.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.config.store.ConfigStore;
033import org.apache.juneau.cp.Messages;
034import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.microservice.*;
036import org.apache.juneau.microservice.console.ConsoleCommand;
037import org.apache.juneau.parser.ParseException;
038import org.apache.juneau.reflect.ClassInfo;
039import org.apache.juneau.rest.annotation.Rest;
040import org.apache.juneau.rest.servlet.RestServlet;
041import org.apache.juneau.svl.*;
042import org.eclipse.jetty.server.*;
043import org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler;
044import org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.*;
045import org.eclipse.jetty.servlet.*;
046
047/**
048 * Entry point for Juneau microservice that implements a REST interface using Jetty on a single port.
049 *
050 * <h5 class='topic'>Jetty Server Details</h5>
051 *
052 * The Jetty server is created by the {@link #createServer()} method and started with the {@link #startServer()} method.
053 * These methods can be overridden to provided customized behavior.
054 *
055 * <h5 class='topic'>Defining REST Resources</h5>
056 *
057 * Top-level REST resources are defined in the <c>jetty.xml</c> file as normal servlets.
058 *
059 * <ul class='seealso'>
060 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-microservice-jetty">juneau-microservice-jetty</a>
061 * </ul>
062 */
063public class JettyMicroservice extends Microservice {
064
065   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
066   // Static
067   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
068
069   private static volatile JettyMicroservice INSTANCE;
070
071   private static void setInstance(JettyMicroservice m) {
072      synchronized(JettyMicroservice.class) {
073         INSTANCE = m;
074      }
075   }
076
077   /**
078    * Returns the Microservice instance.
079    * <p>
080    * This method only works if there's only one Microservice instance in a JVM.
081    * Otherwise, it's just overwritten by the last instantiated microservice.
082    *
083    * @return The Microservice instance, or <jk>null</jk> if there isn't one.
084    */
085   public static JettyMicroservice getInstance() {
086      synchronized(JettyMicroservice.class) {
087         return INSTANCE;
088      }
089   }
090
091   /**
092    * Entry-point method.
093    *
094    * @param args Command line arguments.
095    * @throws Exception Error occurred.
096    */
097   public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
098      JettyMicroservice
099         .create()
100         .args(args)
101         .build()
102         .start()
103         .startConsole()
104         .join();
105   }
106
107   /**
108    * Creates a new microservice builder.
109    *
110    * @return A new microservice builder.
111    */
112   public static Builder create() {
113      return new Builder();
114   }
115
116   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
117   // Builder
118   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
119
120   /**
121    * Builder class.
122    */
123   public static class Builder extends Microservice.Builder {
124
125      String jettyXml;
126      int[] ports;
127      Boolean jettyXmlResolveVars;
128      Map<String,Servlet> servlets = map();
129      Map<String,Object> servletAttributes = map();
130      JettyMicroserviceListener listener;
131      JettyServerFactory factory;
132
133      /**
134       * Constructor.
135       */
136      protected Builder() {}
137
138      /**
139       * Copy constructor.
140       *
141       * @param copyFrom The builder to copy settings from.
142       */
143      protected Builder(Builder copyFrom) {
144         super(copyFrom);
145         this.jettyXml = copyFrom.jettyXml;
146         this.ports = copyFrom.ports;
147         this.jettyXmlResolveVars = copyFrom.jettyXmlResolveVars;
148         this.servlets = copyOf(copyFrom.servlets);
149         this.servletAttributes = copyOf(copyFrom.servletAttributes);
150         this.listener = copyFrom.listener;
151      }
152
153      @Override /* MicroserviceBuilder */
154      public Builder copy() {
155         return new Builder(this);
156      }
157
158      /**
159       * Specifies the contents or location of the <c>jetty.xml</c> file used by the Jetty server.
160       *
161       * <p>
162       * If you do not specify this value, it is pulled from the following in the specified order:
163       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
164       *    <li>
165       *       <c>Jetty/config</c> setting in the config file.
166       *       <c>Jetty-Config</c> setting in the manifest file.
167       * </ul>
168       *
169       * <p>
170       * By default, we look for the <c>jetty.xml</c> file in the following locations:
171       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
172       *    <li><c>jetty.xml</c> in home directory.
173       *    <li><c>files/jetty.xml</c> in home directory.
174       *    <li><c>/jetty.xml</c> in classpath.
175       *    <li><c>/files/jetty.xml</c> in classpath.
176       * </ul>
177       *
178       * @param jettyXml
179       *    The contents or location of the file.
180       *    <br>Can be any of the following:
181       *    <ul>
182       *       <li>{@link String} - Relative path to file on file system or classpath.
183       *       <li>{@link File} - File on file system.
184       *       <li>{@link InputStream} - Raw contents as <c>UTF-8</c> encoded stream.
185       *       <li>{@link Reader} - Raw contents.
186       *    </ul>
187       *
188       * @param resolveVars
189       *    If <jk>true</jk>, SVL variables in the file will automatically be resolved.
190       * @return This object.
191       * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
192       */
193      public Builder jettyXml(Object jettyXml, boolean resolveVars) throws IOException {
194         if (jettyXml instanceof String)
195            this.jettyXml = read(resolveFile(jettyXml.toString()));
196         else if (jettyXml instanceof File)
197            this.jettyXml = read((File)jettyXml);
198         else if (jettyXml instanceof InputStream)
199            this.jettyXml = read((InputStream)jettyXml);
200         else if (jettyXml instanceof Reader)
201            this.jettyXml = read((Reader)jettyXml);
202         else
203            throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid object type passed to jettyXml(Object): {0}", className(jettyXml));
204         this.jettyXmlResolveVars = resolveVars;
205         return this;
206      }
207
208      /**
209       * Specifies the ports to use for the web server.
210       *
211       * <p>
212       * You can specify multiple ports.  The first available will be used.  <js>'0'</js> indicates to try a random port.
213       * The resulting available port gets set as the system property <js>"availablePort"</js> which can be referenced in the
214       * <c>jetty.xml</c> file as <js>"$S{availablePort}"</js> (assuming resolveVars is enabled).
215       *
216       * <p>
217       * If you do not specify this value, it is pulled from the following in the specified order:
218       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
219       *    <li>
220       *       <c>Jetty/port</c> setting in the config file.
221       *    <li>
222       *       <c>Jetty-Port</c> setting in the manifest file.
223       *    <li>
224       *       <c>8000</c>
225       * </ul>
226       *
227       * Jetty/port", mf.getWithDefault("Jetty-Port", new int[]{8000}
228       * @param ports The ports to use for the web server.
229       * @return This object.
230       */
231      public Builder ports(int...ports) {
232         this.ports = ports;
233         return this;
234      }
235
236      /**
237       * Adds a servlet to the servlet container.
238       *
239       * <p>
240       * This method can only be used with servlets with no-arg constructors.
241       * <br>The path is pulled from the {@link Rest#path()} annotation.
242       *
243       * @param c The servlet to add to the servlet container.
244       * @return This object.
245       * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
246       */
247      public Builder servlet(Class<? extends RestServlet> c) throws ExecutableException {
248         RestServlet rs;
249         try {
250            rs = c.newInstance();
251         } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException e) {
252            throw new ExecutableException(e);
253         }
254         return servlet(rs, '/' + rs.getPath());
255      }
256
257      /**
258       * Adds a servlet to the servlet container.
259       *
260       * <p>
261       * This method can only be used with servlets with no-arg constructors.
262       *
263       * @param c The servlet to add to the servlet container.
264       * @param path The servlet path spec.
265       * @return This object.
266       * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
267       */
268      public Builder servlet(Class<? extends Servlet> c, String path) throws ExecutableException {
269         try {
270            return servlet(c.newInstance(), path);
271         } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException e) {
272            throw new ExecutableException(e);
273         }
274      }
275
276      /**
277       * Adds a servlet instance to the servlet container.
278       *
279       * @param servlet The servlet to add to the servlet container.
280       * @param path The servlet path spec.
281       * @return This object.
282       */
283      public Builder servlet(Servlet servlet, String path) {
284         servlets.put(path, servlet);
285         return this;
286      }
287
288      /**
289       * Adds a set of servlets to the servlet container.
290       *
291       * @param servlets
292       *    A map of servlets to add to the servlet container.
293       *    <br>Keys are path specs for the servlet.
294       * @return This object.
295       */
296      public Builder servlets(Map<String,Servlet> servlets) {
297         if (servlets != null)
298            this.servlets.putAll(servlets);
299         return this;
300      }
301
302      /**
303       * Adds a servlet attribute to the servlet container.
304       *
305       * @param name The attribute name.
306       * @param value The attribute value.
307       * @return This object.
308       */
309      public Builder servletAttribute(String name, Object value) {
310         this.servletAttributes.put(name, value);
311         return this;
312      }
313
314      /**
315       * Adds a set of servlet attributes to the servlet container.
316       *
317       * @param values The map of attributes.
318       * @return This object.
319       */
320      public Builder servletAttribute(Map<String,Object> values) {
321         if (values != null)
322            this.servletAttributes.putAll(values);
323         return this;
324      }
325
326      /**
327       * Specifies the factory to use for creating the Jetty {@link Server} instance.
328       *
329       * <p>
330       * If not specified, uses {@link BasicJettyServerFactory}.
331       *
332       * @param value The new value for this property.
333       * @return This object.
334       */
335      public Builder jettyServerFactory(JettyServerFactory value) {
336         this.factory = value;
337         return this;
338      }
339
340      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
341      // Inherited from MicroserviceBuilder
342      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
343
344      @Override /* MicroserviceBuilder */
345      public JettyMicroservice build() throws Exception {
346         return new JettyMicroservice(this);
347      }
348

351         super.args(args);
352         return this;
353      }

357         super.args(args);
358         return this;
359      }

362      public Builder manifest(Object manifest) throws IOException {
363         super.manifest(manifest);
364         return this;
365      }

368      public Builder logger(Logger logger) {
369         super.logger(logger);
370         return this;
371      }
372

374      public Builder config(Config config) {
375         super.config(config);
376         return this;
377      }
378
379      @Override /* MicroserviceBuilder */
380      public Builder configName(String configName) {
381         super.configName(configName);
382         return this;
383      }
384
385      @Override /* MicroserviceBuilder */
386      public Builder configStore(ConfigStore configStore) {
387         super.configStore(configStore);
388         return this;
389      }
390
391      @Override /* MicroserviceBuilder */
392      public Builder consoleEnabled(boolean consoleEnabled) {
393         super.consoleEnabled(consoleEnabled);
394         return this;
395      }
396
397      @Override /* MicroserviceBuilder */
398      public Builder consoleCommands(ConsoleCommand...consoleCommands) {
399         super.consoleCommands(consoleCommands);
400         return this;
401      }
402
403      @Override /* MicroserviceBuilder */
404      public Builder console(Scanner consoleReader, PrintWriter consoleWriter) {
405         super.console(consoleReader, consoleWriter);
406         return this;
407      }
408
409      @Override /* MicroserviceBuilder */
410      @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
411      public Builder vars(Class<? extends Var>...vars) {
412         super.vars(vars);
413         return this;
414      }
415
416      @Override /* MicroserviceBuilder */
417      public <T> Builder varBean(Class<T> c, T value) {
418         super.varBean(c, value);
419         return this;
420      }
421
422      @Override /* MicroserviceBuilder */
423      public Builder workingDir(File path) {
424         super.workingDir(path);
425         return this;
426      }
427
428      @Override /* MicroserviceBuilder */
429      public Builder workingDir(String path) {
430         super.workingDir(path);
431         return this;
432      }
433
434      /**
435       * Registers an event listener for this microservice.
436       *
437       * @param listener An event listener for this microservice.
438       * @return This object.
439       */
440      public Builder listener(JettyMicroserviceListener listener) {
441         super.listener(listener);
442         this.listener = listener;
443         return this;
444      }
445   }
446
447   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
448   // Instance
449   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
450
451   final Messages messages = Messages.of(JettyMicroservice.class);
452
453   private final Builder builder;
454   final JettyMicroserviceListener listener;
455   private final JettyServerFactory factory;
456
457   volatile Server server;
458
459   /**
460    * Constructor.
461    *
462    * @param builder The constructor arguments.
463    * @throws IOException Problem occurred reading file.
464    * @throws ParseException Malformed content found in config file.
465    */
466   protected JettyMicroservice(Builder builder) throws ParseException, IOException {
467      super(builder);
468      setInstance(this);
469      this.builder = builder.copy();
470      this.listener = builder.listener != null ? builder.listener : new BasicJettyMicroserviceListener();
471      this.factory = builder.factory != null ? builder.factory : new BasicJettyServerFactory();
472   }
473
474   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
475   // Methods implemented on Microservice API
476   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
477
478   @Override /* Microservice */
479   public synchronized JettyMicroservice init() throws ParseException, IOException {
480      super.init();
481      return this;
482   }
483
484   @Override /* Microservice */
485   public synchronized JettyMicroservice startConsole() throws Exception {
486      super.startConsole();
487      return this;
488   }
489
490   @Override /* Microservice */
491   public synchronized JettyMicroservice stopConsole() throws Exception {
492      super.stopConsole();
493      return this;
494   }
495
496   @Override /* Microservice */
497   public synchronized JettyMicroservice start() throws Exception {
498      super.start();
499      createServer();
500      startServer();
501      return this;
502   }
503
504   @Override /* Microservice */
505   public JettyMicroservice join() throws Exception {
506      server.join();
507      return this;
508   }
509
510   @Override /* Microservice */
511   public synchronized JettyMicroservice stop() throws Exception {
512      final Logger logger = getLogger();
513      final Messages mb2 = messages;
514      Thread t = new Thread("JettyMicroserviceStop") {
515         @Override /* Thread */
516         public void run() {
517            try {
518               if (server == null || server.isStopping() || server.isStopped())
519                  return;
520               listener.onStopServer(JettyMicroservice.this);
521               out(mb2, "StoppingServer");
522               server.stop();
523               out(mb2, "ServerStopped");
524               listener.onPostStopServer(JettyMicroservice.this);
525            } catch (Exception e) {
526               logger.log(Level.WARNING, e.getLocalizedMessage(), e);
527            }
528         }
529      };
530      t.start();
531      try {
532         t.join();
533      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
534         e.printStackTrace();
535      }
536      super.stop();
537
538      return this;
539   }
540
541
542   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
543   // JettyMicroservice API methods.
544   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
545
546   /**
547    * Returns the port that this microservice started up on.
548    * <p>
549    * The value is determined by looking at the <c>Server/Connectors[ServerConnector]/port</c> value in the
550    * Jetty configuration.
551    *
552    * @return The port that this microservice started up on.
553    */
554   public int getPort() {
555      for (Connector c : getServer().getConnectors())
556         if (c instanceof ServerConnector)
557            return ((ServerConnector)c).getPort();
558      throw new RuntimeException("Could not locate ServerConnector in Jetty server.");
559   }
560
561   /**
562    * Returns the context path that this microservice is using.
563    * <p>
564    * The value is determined by looking at the <c>Server/Handlers[ServletContextHandler]/contextPath</c> value
565    * in the Jetty configuration.
566    *
567    * @return The context path that this microservice is using.
568    */
569   public String getContextPath() {
570      for (Handler h : getServer().getHandlers()) {
571         if (h instanceof HandlerCollection)
572            for (Handler h2 : ((HandlerCollection)h).getChildHandlers())
573               if (h2 instanceof ServletContextHandler)
574                  return ((ServletContextHandler)h2).getContextPath();
575         if (h instanceof ServletContextHandler)
576            return ((ServletContextHandler)h).getContextPath();
577      }
578      throw new RuntimeException("Could not locate ServletContextHandler in Jetty server.");
579   }
580
581   /**
582    * Returns whether this microservice is using <js>"http"</js> or <js>"https"</js>.
583    * <p>
584    * The value is determined by looking for the existence of an SSL Connection Factorie by looking for the
585    * <c>Server/Connectors[ServerConnector]/ConnectionFactories[SslConnectionFactory]</c> value in the Jetty
586    * configuration.
587    *
588    * @return Whether this microservice is using <js>"http"</js> or <js>"https"</js>.
589    */
590   public String getProtocol() {
591      for (Connector c : getServer().getConnectors())
592         if (c instanceof ServerConnector)
593            for (ConnectionFactory cf : ((ServerConnector)c).getConnectionFactories())
594               if (cf instanceof SslConnectionFactory)
595                  return "https";
596      return "http";
597   }
598
599   /**
600    * Returns the hostname of this microservice.
601    * <p>
602    * Simply uses <c>InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostName()</c>.
603    *
604    * @return The hostname of this microservice.
605    */
606   public String getHostName() {
607      String hostname = "localhost";
608      try {
609         hostname = InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostName();
610      } catch (UnknownHostException e) {}
611      return hostname;
612   }
613
614   /**
615    * Returns the URI where this microservice is listening on.
616    *
617    * @return The URI where this microservice is listening on.
618    */
619   public URI getURI() {
620      String cp = getContextPath();
621      try {
622         return new URI(getProtocol(), null, getHostName(), getPort(), "/".equals(cp) ? null : cp, null, null);
623      } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
624         throw asRuntimeException(e);
625      }
626   }
627
628   /**
629    * Method used to create (but not start) an instance of a Jetty server.
630    *
631    * <p>
632    * Subclasses can override this method to customize the Jetty server before it is started.
633    *
634    * <p>
635    * The default implementation is configured by the following values in the config file
636    * if a jetty.xml is not specified via a <c>REST/jettyXml</c> setting:
637    * <p class='bini'>
638    *    <cc>#================================================================================
639    *    # Jetty settings
640    *    #================================================================================</cc>
641    *    <cs>[Jetty]</cs>
642    *
643    *    <cc># Path of the jetty.xml file used to configure the Jetty server.</cc>
644    *    <ck>config</ck> = jetty.xml
645    *
646    *    <cc># Resolve Juneau variables in the jetty.xml file.</cc>
647    *    <ck>resolveVars</ck> = true
648    *
649    *    <cc># Port to use for the jetty server.
650    *    # You can specify multiple ports.  The first available will be used.  '0' indicates to try a random port.
651    *    # The resulting available port gets set as the system property "availablePort" which can be referenced in the
652    *    # jetty.xml file as "$S{availablePort}" (assuming resolveVars is enabled).</cc>
653    *    <ck>port</ck> = 10000,0,0,0
654    * </p>
655    *
656    * @return The newly-created server.
657    * @throws ParseException Configuration file contains malformed input.
658    * @throws IOException File could not be read.
659    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
660    */
661   public Server createServer() throws ParseException, IOException, ExecutableException {
662      listener.onCreateServer(this);
663
664      Config cf = getConfig();
665      JsonMap mf = getManifest();
666      VarResolver vr = getVarResolver();
667
668      int[] ports = ObjectUtils.firstNonNull(builder.ports, cf.get("Jetty/port").as(int[].class).orElseGet(()->mf.getWithDefault("Jetty-Port", new int[]{8000}, int[].class)));
669      int availablePort = findOpenPort(ports);
670
671      if (System.getProperty("availablePort") == null)
672         System.setProperty("availablePort", String.valueOf(availablePort));
673
674      String jettyXml = builder.jettyXml;
675      String jettyConfig = cf.get("Jetty/config").orElse(mf.getString("Jetty-Config", "jetty.xml"));
676      boolean resolveVars = ObjectUtils.firstNonNull(builder.jettyXmlResolveVars, cf.get("Jetty/resolveVars").asBoolean().orElse(false));
677
678      if (jettyXml == null)
679         jettyXml = IOUtils.loadSystemResourceAsString("jetty.xml", ".", "files");
680      if (jettyXml == null)
681         throw new BasicRuntimeException("jetty.xml file ''{0}'' was not found on the file system or classpath.", jettyConfig);
682
683      if (resolveVars)
684         jettyXml = vr.resolve(jettyXml);
685
686      getLogger().info(jettyXml);
687
688      try {
689         server = factory.create(jettyXml);
690      } catch (Exception e2) {
691         throw new ExecutableException(e2);
692      }
693
694      for (String s : cf.get("Jetty/servlets").asStringArray().orElse(new String[0])) {
695         try {
696            ClassInfo c = ClassInfo.of(Class.forName(s));
697            if (c.isChildOf(RestServlet.class)) {
698               RestServlet rs = (RestServlet)c.newInstance();
699               addServlet(rs, rs.getPath());
700            } else {
701               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid servlet specified in Jetty/servlets.  Must be a subclass of RestServlet: {0}", s);
702            }
703         } catch (ClassNotFoundException e1) {
704            throw new ExecutableException(e1);
705         }
706      }
707
708      cf.get("Jetty/servletMap").asMap().orElse(EMPTY_MAP).forEach((k,v) -> {
709         try {
710            ClassInfo c = ClassInfo.of(Class.forName(v.toString()));
711            if (c.isChildOf(Servlet.class)) {
712               Servlet rs = (Servlet)c.newInstance();
713               addServlet(rs, k);
714            } else {
715               throw new BasicRuntimeException("Invalid servlet specified in Jetty/servletMap.  Must be a subclass of Servlet: {0}", v);
716            }
717         } catch (ClassNotFoundException e1) {
718            throw new ExecutableException(e1);
719         }
720      });
721
722      cf.get("Jetty/servletAttributes").asMap().orElse(EMPTY_MAP).forEach((k,v) -> addServletAttribute(k, v));
723
724      builder.servlets.forEach((k,v) -> addServlet(v, k));
725
726      builder.servletAttributes.forEach((k,v) -> addServletAttribute(k, v));
727
728      if (System.getProperty("juneau.serverPort") == null)
729         System.setProperty("juneau.serverPort", String.valueOf(availablePort));
730
731      return server;
732   }
733
734   /**
735    * Calls {@link Server#destroy()} on the underlying Jetty server if it exists.
736    *
737    * @throws Exception Error occurred.
738    */
739   public void destroyServer() throws Exception {
740      if (server != null)
741         server.destroy();
742      server = null;
743   }
744
745   /**
746    * Adds an arbitrary servlet to this microservice.
747    *
748    * @param servlet The servlet instance.
749    * @param pathSpec The context path of the servlet.
750    * @return This object.
751    * @throws RuntimeException if {@link #createServer()} has not previously been called.
752    */
753   public JettyMicroservice addServlet(Servlet servlet, String pathSpec) {
754      ServletHolder sh = new ServletHolder(servlet);
755      if (pathSpec != null && ! pathSpec.endsWith("/*"))
756         pathSpec = trimTrailingSlashes(pathSpec) + "/*";
757      getServletContextHandler().addServlet(sh, pathSpec);
758      return this;
759   }
760
761   /**
762    * Finds and returns the servlet context handler define in the Jetty container.
763    *
764    * @return The servlet context handler.
765    * @throws RuntimeException if context handler is not defined.
766    */
767   protected ServletContextHandler getServletContextHandler() {
768      for (Handler h : getServer().getHandlers()) {
769         ServletContextHandler sch = getServletContextHandler(h);
770         if (sch != null)
771            return sch;
772      }
773      throw new RuntimeException("Servlet context handler not found in jetty server.");
774   }
775
776   /**
777    * Adds a servlet attribute to the Jetty server.
778    *
779    * @param name The server attribute name.
780    * @param value The context path of the servlet.
781    * @return This object.
782    * @throws RuntimeException if {@link #createServer()} has not previously been called.
783    */
784   public JettyMicroservice addServletAttribute(String name, Object value) {
785      getServer().setAttribute(name, value);
786      return this;
787   }
788
789   /**
790    * Returns the underlying Jetty server.
791    *
792    * @return The underlying Jetty server, or <jk>null</jk> if {@link #createServer()} has not yet been called.
793    */
794   public Server getServer() {
795      if (server == null)
796         throw new RuntimeException("Server not found.  createServer() must be called first.");
797      return server;
798   }
799
800   /**
801    * Method used to start the Jetty server created by {@link #createServer()}.
802    *
803    * <p>
804    * Subclasses can override this method to customize server startup.
805    *
806    * @return The port that this server started on.
807    * @throws Exception Error occurred.
808    */
809   protected int startServer() throws Exception {
810      listener.onStartServer(this);
811      server.start();
812      out(messages, "ServerStarted", getPort());
813      listener.onPostStartServer(this);
814      return getPort();
815   }
816
817   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
818   // Utility methods
819   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
820
821   private static ServletContextHandler getServletContextHandler(Handler h) {
822      if (h instanceof ServletContextHandler)
823         return (ServletContextHandler)h;
824      if (h instanceof HandlerCollection) {
825         for (Handler h2 : ((HandlerCollection)h).getHandlers()) {
826            ServletContextHandler sch = getServletContextHandler(h2);
827            if (sch != null)
828               return sch;
829         }
830      }
831      return null;
832   }
833
834   private static int findOpenPort(int[] ports) {
835      for (int port : ports) {
836         // If port is 0, try a random port between ports[0] and 32767.
837         if (port == 0)
838            port = new Random().nextInt(32767 - ports[0] + 1) + ports[0];
839         try (ServerSocket ss = new ServerSocket(port)) {
840            return port;
841         } catch (IOException e) {}
842      }
843      return 0;
844   }
845}
